content:
• Thursday, February 1, 2018
  • GOOG

    Key takeaways from Alphabet's Q4 earnings call

    • Alphabet’s (NASDAQ:GOOG) Q4 call was heavy on talk but short on details. Here’s what we did find out:
    • Earnings were up 18% on the year, ex-EU fine.  
    • Management explained higher TAC on the fact that stronger growth areas (mobile revenue) require higher costs. The company expects year-over-year growth in site TC to slow after Q1. 
    • Mobile search and YouTube biggest contributors to revenue growth. 
    • YouTube stats: Users watch an average of 60 minutes a day on mobile (phones and tablets); 1.5B monthly viewers; YouTube TV now available in 30 markets.   
    • Responds to COGS pressure by saying it reflects product mix. 
    • Waymo progress is accelerating and has surpassed 4M miles of driving in the real world. 
    • Excited about 2018 investments in biggest bets: cloud, hardware, YouTube, and machine learning. 
    • Google Cloud already a billion-dollar per quarter business. 
    • Stock repurchase: Authorizes an $8.6B stock repurchase of Class C stock. 
    • Alphabet Class C shares are down 2.3% aftermarket.    
    • Previously: Alphabet misses by $0.37, beats on revenue (Feb. 1)
    • Previously: Alphabet -3.2% after Q4 EPS miss, higher TAC; Hennessy chosen as chairman (Feb. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:32 PM | 7 Comments
  • OSIS

    OSI Systems discloses SEC, DoJ probes in wake of Muddy Waters report

    • OSI Systems (NASDAQ:OSIS) -18.3% after-hours following its disclosure that the SEC has launched an investigation into the company's compliance with the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.
    • OSIS says the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Central District of California also has said it would request information regarding FCPA compliance.
    • OSIS says the probes are in response to a short seller; Muddy Waters has accused the company bribed its way to win a major contract in Albania (I, II).
    • The SEC and DOJ also are investigating trading in the company’s securities, and have subpoenaed relevant information from executives, directors and employees.
    • Separately, OSIS reported Q4 earnings and revenues that topped analyst consensus estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • IHRTQ

    IHeartMedia slips as unit skips $106M debt payment

    • IHeartMedia (IHRT) closed down 10% today after word that iHeartCommunications is skipping its payment today due to holders of its 14% notes due 2021.
    • That's a $106M payment it's missing; it won't yet trigger an event of default as the company will use a 30-day grace period.
    • Discussions continue among lenders, noteholders and financial sponsors over a comprehensive restructuring, the company says.
    • But the company has cash on hand, S&P says, and therefore forgoing the payment is strategic and designed to pressure debtholders. It's downgrading iHeart, saying the company's unlikely to make good on the payment.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Apple: No soft Q2 for iPhones, plans to reduce $163B net cash to "approximately zero"

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) drops some more metrics during its earnings call, and the CFO has an interview with the Financial Times.
    • Call stats: 
    • Q1 was one week shorter than 1Q17 (noted more than once) and average revenue per week was up 21%. 
    • Active install base reached 1.3B in January (a new high). 
    • Paid subscriptions among services passed 240M (largest quarterly growth ever, up 30M in 90 days). 
    • Apple Watch unit sales up 50% for the quarter with Watch 3 volume twice that of Series 2 last year. 
    • Wearables (AirPods, Watch, Beats) second largest contributor to revenue growth.
    • March quarter downside guidance (and news reports) hint at slow revenue and iPhone shipments, but Apple expects 13% to 17% unit growth of higher-priced iPhones with revenue $7B to $9B higher on the year. Expects sell-through to accelerate during March quarter (compared to December). 
    • CFO interview: 
    • Apple CFO Luca Maestro says the company plans to reduce its net cash balance to “approximately zero” thanks to the U.S. tax reform, according to an interview with FT. 
    • Apple ended the year with $163B in cash net of debt and last month announced plans to pay the government $38B on its overseas cash pile. 
    • Maestri says the details will come in April, which is when the company typically discusses capital allocation plans.
    • ”Our target over time is to take that $163 down to approximately zero. All that cash will be deployed for capital allocation,” says Maestri. He says this can include M&A, dividends, and buybacks. 
    • Apple shares are up 3.5% aftermarket. 
    • Previously: Apple beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Feb. 1)
    • Previously: Apple declares $0.63 dividend (Feb. 1)
    • Previously: Apple -1% on Q1 unit sales drop, downside guidance (Feb. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM | 171 Comments
  • CY

    Cypress Semi +1.1% after Q4 beats, in-line guidance

    • Cypress Semiconductor (NASDAQ:CY) shares are up 1.1% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates.
    • In-line Q1 guidance: Revenue, $565M to $595M (consensus: $576.62M); EPS, $0.22 to $0.26 (consensus: $0.22); gross margin, 44.5% to 45.5%. 
    • Revenue breakdown: MCD, $357.2M (-4% Q/Q); MPD, $240.3M (+4%).   
    • Key metrics: Non-GAAP margin, 45.4% (+530 bps Y/Y); cash and equivalents, $151.6M; total liabilities, $1.72B. 
    • Press release    
    • Previously: Cypress Semiconductor beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (Feb. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 2 Comments
  • DATA

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (2/1/2018)

    • Top gainers: DATA +15.5%. VIAV +7.5%. DECK +6.9%. AMZN +5.7%. PTI +4.4%.
    • Top losers: PI -27.8%. OSIS -18.1%. NGVC -15.2%. MAT -8.9%. YRCW -7.7%.

  • DATA

    Tableau Software +15.5% on Q4 beats, upside FY18 revenue guidance

    • Tableau Software (NYSE:DATA) shares are up 15.5% aftermarket following Q4 results that beat revenue and EPS estimates.
    • Q1 guidance (from earnings call): Revenue, $212M to $222M (consensus: $213M); EPS, -$1.70 to -$0.24 (consensus: -$0.03); non-GAAP operating loss, $20M to $27M. 
    • Mixed FY18 guidance: Revenue, $945M to $985M (consensus: $940M); EPS, $0.11 (consensus: $0.24); non-GAAP operating margin, targeting break even tax rate, about 20%. 
    • Key metrics: Total annual recurring revenue was $596.2M (+45% Y/Y). Ratable license bookings were 51% of total license bookings, compared to 20% in 4Q16. Operating expenses were $262.6M, and the company ended the year with $627.8M in cash and equivalents. 
    • Share repurchases: Tableau repurchased 284,851 shares of common stock in the quarter for a total of $20M. Company authorized to repurchase a remaining $100M under previously authorized repurchase program. 
    • Staff change: CFO Tom Walker steps down to take a six-month sabbatical. SVP of Finance Damon Fletcher will become interim CFO. 
    • Board member: The Board appoints Starbucks EVP and CTO Gerri Martin-Flickinger as a new director. 
    • Press release  
    • Previously: Tableau Software beats by $0.09, beats on revenue (Feb. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • SHLX

    Shell Midstream to launch 25M-unit offering

    • Shell Midstream Partners (NYSE:SHLX) -5.4% after-hours as it announces a public offering of 25M common units, with an underwriters option to purchase up to another 3.75M units, and a $300M private placement of its common units to Shell Midstream LP Holdings.
    • SHLX says it plans to use the proceeds from the public offering and private placement to repay amounts outstanding under its credit facilities and for general partnership purposes.
    • SHLX also discloses guidance for Q4 net income and adjusted EBITDA, seeing net income of $78.9M-$91.7M and EBITDA of $109.6M-$127.4M.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 6 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple -1% on Q1 unit sales drop, downside guidance

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) shares slip 1% aftermarket following Q1 results that beat revenue and EPS estimates but missed on unit shipments and included a downside Q2 guidance.
    • Downside Q2 guidance: revenue, $60B to $62B (consensus: $65.62B); gross margin, 38% to 38.5%; operating expenses, $7.6B to $7.7B; tax rate, about 15%.
    • Unit sales (Y/Y growth; consensus estimate): iPhone, 77.3M (-1% Y/Y in units, +13% in revenue; estimate: 81.5M); iPad, 13.1M (+1% in units, +6% in revenue; 13.7M); Mac, 5.1M (-5% in units and revenue; 5.6M); Services, $8.47B (+18%); Other Products, $5.5B (+36%).
    • Average selling price: Apple reported $796, analysts expected $755.
    • China: China revenue up 11% on the year to $17.96B. Analysts expected +9.2% growth to $17.73B.
    • Cash reserve: Record $285.1B. 
    • Apple will hold its Q1 earnings call at 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here. 
    • Previously: Apple declares $0.63 dividend (Feb. 1)
    • Previously: Apple beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Feb. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 133 Comments
  • ATOS

    Atossa's endoxifen shows much quicker absorption than tamoxifen in early-stage study; shares up 10% after hours

    • Nano cap Atossa Genetics (NASDAQ:ATOS) is up 10% after hours on robust volume after it announced new Phase 1 data on breast cancer candidate endoxifen.
    • The median time for orally administered endoxifen to reach steady-state serum levels was seven days, substantially quicker than oral tamoxifen, which takes 50 - 200 days (both drugs once/day).
    • Median time to reach maximum serum levels was four-to-eight hours (dose dependent) for endoxifen. The 4 mg daily dose produced a maximum serum level in the this time frame above the generally accepted threshold for a therapeutic effect on estrogen-dependent breast cancer.
    • CEO Steve Quay, Ph.D., M.D., says, “These additional findings are important for several reasons. Breast cancer patients do not typically want to wait weeks or even months for the current standard of care, oral tamoxifen, to take effect. Our study data indicates that our proprietary oral Endoxifen reaches a steady-state in about 7 days, while the literature indicates that it can take 50-200 days for tamoxifen to reach a steady-state – keeping in mind that a breast cancer tumor can double in size in as little as 29 days. Not only does it take up to several months for oral tamoxifen to take effect, oral tamoxifen also does not benefit up to 50% of patients, partly because many patients cannot metabolize tamoxifen. For these reasons, we believe our oral Endoxifen may reduce the incidence of this deadly disease and fundamentally change the paradigm for breast cancer treatment,” added Dr. Quay.
    • Previously: Atossa Genetics to host conference call tomorrow on Phase 1 endoxifen data; shares ahead 17% premarket (Jan. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 7 Comments
  • DECK

    Smashing quarter from Deckers

    • Deckers Brands (NASDAQ:DECK) obliterates consensus estimates with its FQ3 report.
    • Sales were up 6.3% on a constant currency basis. UGG brand sales rose only 4.3% despite the cold winter and Teva sales were up 33%.
    • Gross margin improved 170 bps to 52.2% of sales.
    • The company says it intends to repatriate $250M by the end of the fiscal year.
    • DECK +7.61% AH to $93.90.
    • Previously: Deckers Outdoor beats by $1.15, beats on revenue (Feb. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • RFP

    Resolute Forest tanks 29% as trucker shortage slows operations

    • Resolute Forest Products (NYSE:RFP) plunged 29% in today's trade on the NYSE after missing Q4 earnings estimates, as the company said a shortage of truckers in Canada is hindering shipments from its sawmills to paper mills.
    • RFP is now using oversized trailers for its loads and has introduced special hiring and training programs to attract workers, CEO Richard Garneau said in today's earnings conference call.
    • RFP says its freight costs rose in 2017 because of an increase in rates, shipping distances and issues related to the truck driver shortage.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • GPRO

    GoPro slides another 3.5% after Q4 miss

    • Q4 non-GAAP loss of $41.3M or $0.41 per share vs. profit of $42.4M or $0.29 per share a year ago. Adjusted EBITDA loss of $26.5M vs. profit of $44.3M.
    • Non-GAAP gross margin of 24.8% vs. 39.5% a year ago.
    • Revenue of $334.8M down 38.1% Y/Y.
    • Company is targeting non-GAAP operating expenses to be less than $400M in 2018 vs. $476M last year (which was down 33% from 2016).
    • Conference call at 5 ET
    • Previously: GoPro misses by $0.19, misses on revenue (Feb. 1)
    • GPRO -3.45% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 13 Comments
  • MSI

    Motorola Solutions +1.9% after capping record year for sales

    • Motorola Solutions (NYSE:MSI) is up 1.9% in postmarket trading following a Q4 report where solid results led to record full-year sales, backlog and cash flow.
    • Revenues rose 6.4%; on an organic basis, it was up 2%. Backlog rose 15% to a record $9.6B.
    • The company posted a loss in GAAP terms, after taking charges of $874M tied to tax reform. Non-GAAP effective tax rate was 32.8% vs. a year-ago 30.7%.
    • "We are poised for continued growth in (land-mobile radio) and software and services," says CEO Greg Brown.
    • Gross margin grew to $970M from a year-ago $928M.
    • Net sales breakout: Products, $1.23B (up 0.6%); Services, $724M (up 10.2%).
    • Operating cash is $761M (up $248M Y/Y), and free cash flow came to $740M (up $287M), from higher operating earnings and improved performance in working capital.
    • For its Q1, it's guiding to revenue growth of 7% Y/Y and EPS of $0.83-$0.88 (above consensus for $0.82). For the full fiscal 2018, it sees revenue growth of about 5% and EPS of $6.50-$6.65 (well above expectations for $5.94).
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • GOOG

    Alphabet -3.2% after Q4 EPS miss, higher TAC; Hennessy chosen as chairman

    • Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) shares are down 3.2% aftermarket after reporting Q4 earnings that beat revenue estimates but missed on EPS.
    • Advertising revenue was up 22% on the year to $27.2B. Ad sales represented about 84% of the total, down from nearly 86% in last year’s quarter.
    • Aggregate paid clicks were up 43% on the year and 18% sequentially. Aggregate cost-per-click fell 14% on the year and 6% on the quarter.
    • Total TAC was $6.45B, above the $6.27B analyst estimate and up 33% on the year. Increase at least partially due to pricier contracts with Apple.
    • Other revenue was up 38% to $4.69B, compared to the $4.58B consensus estimate.
    • Other bets was 56% to $409M.  Segment operating loss was $916M compared to last year’s loss of $1.1B.
    • Board authorizes the company to buy back up to $8.6B of Class C stock.
    • John Hennessy is selected to replace Eric Schmidt as chairman. Hennessy has been on the board since 2004, and lead independent director since 2007.
    • Press release
    • Source: Press Release
    • Previously: Alphabet misses by $0.37, beats on revenue (Feb. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 11 Comments
  • ATHN

    Q4 sales up 14% at athenahealth, earnings up 122%; shares up 13% after hours

    • Athenahealth (NASDAQ:ATHN) Q4 results ($M): Revenue: 329.2 (+14.2%).
    • Net Income: 31.6 (+122.4%); non-GAAP net income: 45.1 (+80.4%); EPS: 0.78 (+225.0%); non-GAAP EPS: 1.11 (+79.0%).
    • 2018 guidance will be announced during the Investor Summit on February 15.
    • Shares are up 13% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon rallies after strong holiday sales, AWS lift

    • Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) topped $60B for the holiday quarter as it notched out 36% growth on a constant-currency basis.
    • North American revenue rose 42% to $37.3B, while international sales ran up 29% to $18B. AWS was a beast again, posting 45% revenue growth to $5.1B. Amazon's sales mix was 60% from North America, 32% from International 32% and AWS at 8%.
    • Operating income jumped 69% to $2.1B to easily top the company's own guidance. AWS generated over a $1B of the OI.
    • Q4 also included a provisional tax benefit for the impact of the tax bill of ~$789M.
    • CEO Jeff Bezos gives a shout-out to Alexa, instead of diving into numbers. "Our 2017 projections for Alexa were very optimistic, and we far exceeded them. We don’t see positive surprises of this magnitude very often — expect us to double down," says Bezos.
    • Guidance from Amazon was roughly in-line at Q1 revenue of $47.75B to $48.71B vs. $48.7B consensus.
    • Shares of Amazon are up 2.75% in AH trading to cut into the 4.2% loss posted earlier today.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 59 Comments

    Edwards Lifesciences beats by $0.03, beats on revenue

  • VIAV

    Viavi Solutions +5.8% as Q2 clears consensus

    • Viavi Solutions (NASDAQ:VIAV) has gained 5.8% after hours on fiscal Q2 earnings where net income declined but the company beat on top and bottom lines.
    • Revenues dipped 2.3% Y/Y as a 21% decline in Service Enablement wasn't entirely mitigated by gains in Network Enablement.
    • Net income (non-GAAP) fell to $20.2M from a year-ago $23.6M.
    • "Looking ahead, we anticipate continued strength in network test spending and broader 3D Sensing product adoption in calendar 2018m," said CEO Oleg Khaykin in a statement.
    • Revenue by segment: Network Enablement, $121.5M (up 3.8%); Service Enablement, $32.1M (down 20.9%); Optical Security and Performance Products, $48.2M (down 1.4%).
    • It's guiding to Q3 revenue of $190M-$210M (vs. consensus for $193.4M) and EPS of $0.08-$0.10 (in line with consensus for $0.09).
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • MAT

    Mattel slides after weak quarter

    • Mattel (NASDAQ:MAT) reports a 12% drop in sales in Q4 after another weak performance in North America.
    • Revenue in North America was off 17% Y/Y with the Toys "R" us bankrupcty cited as a drag.
    • Sales from the American Girls Brands busines fell off 21%, while Fisher-Price Brands sales were down 11%.
    • Gross margin plummeted to 30.7% of sales vs. 47.0% a year ago.
    • CEO update: "We have taken aggressive action to enter 2018 with a clean slate so that we can reset our economic model and rapidly improve profitability. We are optimistic about stabilizing revenue in 2018 anchored by our key power brands, entertainment partnerships and exciting new launches. We continue to gain momentum toward the medium-term goals we shared at our June Investor Day."
    • Previously: Mattel misses by $0.89, misses on revenue (Feb. 1)
    • Shares of Mattel are down 5.38% AH to $14.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • AMGN

    Amgen Q4 top line off 3%; non-GAAP EPS flat; shares down 5% after hours

    • Amgen (NASDAQ:AMGN) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 5,802 (-2.7%); Product sales: 5,569 (-1.7%).
    • Net Loss: (4,264) (-320.4%); non-GAAP net income: 2,104 (-2.6%); loss/share: (5.89) (-327.4%); non-GAAP EPS: 2.89 (flat).
    • GAAP results were negatively impacted by the income tax effect from the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.
    • Key product sales: Repatha: 98 (+69.0%); BLINCYTO: 46 (+58.6%); Prolia: 574 (+24.0%); KYPROLIS: 227 (+24.0%); Vectibix: 159 (+11.2%); Enbel: 1,423 (-13.4%).
    • 2018 Guidance: Revenues: $21.8B - 22.8B; EPS: $11.18 - 12.36; non-GAAP EPS: $12.60 - 13.70.
    • Shares are down 5% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 13 Comments

  • ES

    Eversource -5% as New Hampshire regulator denies Northern Pass project

    • Eversource Energy (ES -4.9%) plunges on news that a New Hampshire state committee denied its application for the Northern Pass transmission project.
    • The Site Evaluation Committee voted unanimously that Northern Pass had not met its burden to show the proposed transmission line would not “unduly interfere with the orderly development of the region."
    • The next step will be for the committee to issue a written decision by March 31, and Northern Pass then can request a motion for rehearing before the committee.
    • Massachusetts officials last week selected Northern Pass over ~40 candidates to provide renewable energy to the state.
    • The planned 192-mile transmission line would carry power from hydroelectric plants in Canada through New Hampshire into Massachusetts.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • REGN

    Regeneron continues slide, down 6%

    • Regeneron Pharmaceuticals (REGN -5.5%) continues south. Shares have lost over 11% in a week. The company is scheduled to report Q4 earnings on February 8 before the open.
    • Barclay's Geoff Meacham is bearish on the company's prospects (Underweight/$395) citing the saturation of the wet-AMD market which bodes ill for top seller EYLEA (aflibercept).
    • Competitor Lucentis (ranibizumab) generated CHF288M in sales in Q4. Regeneron has pre-announced EYLEA Q4 sales at $985M.
    • Last quarter, the company forecasted ~10% higher U.S. sales for EYLEA this year or ~$3.66B (2016 sales: $3,323.1M). In his JPM18 presentation, CEO Leonard Schlieifer stated that 2017 sales would be ~$3.7B (slide #10), in line with the pre-announced $985M for Q4 ($3,711M for the year).
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM | 39 Comments
  • TXT

    Textron upgraded at Morgan Stanley on potential recovery in bizjet market

    • Textron (TXT +1.7%) is upgraded to Equal Weight from Underweight with a $60 price target, up from $55, at Morgan Stanley, after Q4 results that were "light to in-line" and "weak" 2018 guidance caused shares to move lower yesterday.
    • In its upgrade, Stanley cites improvement in the business jet market and the stock's relative underperformance over the last year.
    • TXT management said during the company's earnings conference call that there is "no question that the level of activity out there is stronger than we've seen in some time" in the bizjet market, which Stanley says creates a bull case potential of 20% revenue growth and 5% margin improvement in the business.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • MSFT

    Analysts raise Microsoft price targets after earnings

    • Canaccord reiterates a Buy rating and raises its Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) price target from $94 to $105 (a 10.5% upside on yesterday’s close).
    • Analyst Richard Davis advises to buy on any dip and says investors will “gradually recognize that the company has four levers to deliver accelerating growth and higher margins (O365, Xbox, CRM, and Azure).”
    • Cowen has Microsoft at Outperform and increases the target by $5 to $100 (5% upside).
    • Gregg Moskowitz cites the quarter’s accelerating growth and says operating margins showed a healthy upside.
    • Jefferies analyst John DiFucci has the only Sell for the company but still increases his target from $57 to $62, which is still a 35% downside.
    • Microsoft shares are down 0.7%. 
    • Previously: Microsoft -1.3% despite Q2 beats, 98% Azure growth (Jan. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 29 Comments
  • GBTC

    Today in markets: Yields break out again, cryptos crash

    • Probably not related, but tight money tends to take a toll on perky assets, no matter where they are (though stocks, for now, have been unaffected).
    • The 10-year Treasury yield today is up 7.5 basis points to a new multi-year high of 2.78%. TLT -1%, TBT +2%
    • Bitcoin's decline is accelerating, now off 14.5% to $8,750. Ethereum, Ripple, Bitcoin Cash, Litecoin, and the rest of the sector are all lower by 15-25%. OTCQX:GBTC -20.6%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 78 Comments
  • INSY

    New York AG goes after Insys; shares down 6%

    • Settling with the Feds over alleged reckless marketing of opioid Subsys (fentanyl) is only half the solution for Insys Therapeutics (INSY -6.4%). Today, New York Attorney General Eric Schneiderman announced that his office has filed a lawsuit against the company accusing it of misconduct in promoting the pain medication. Mr. Schneiderman seeks penalties and disgorgement of all revenues accumulated during the period of misbehavior - up to $75M.
    • NY joins a number of other states going after the company and/or certain former executives.
    • Previously: INSYS creates $150M reserve for potential liability exposure over Subsys marketing; shares halted (Oct. 30, 2017)
    • Previously: New Jersey AG jumps on the Insys-suing bandwagon with four-court lawsuit (Oct. 5, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 7 Comments
  • QNST

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/1/18)

    • Gainers: QNST +36%. RVLT +18%. QRVO +15%. OTEX +14%. NOK +13%.
    • Losers: EGOV -19%. PTI -19%. ESIO -18%. DPW -13%. OTCPK:LFIN -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • ERN

    Erin Energy +11% after discovering hydrocarbons offshore Nigeria

    • Erin Energy (ERN +11.7%) surges following news that it discovered hydrocarbons after completing drilling of an exploratory well offshore Nigeria.

    Apple roundup: Record Q4 for iPhone, refurbished iPhone 7, India import tax hike

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) sold 22.39M iPhones in the U.S. during Q4, according to Counterpoint Research data.
    • The sales pushed Apple to a record 44% market share, up from 37%. 
    • Counterpoint said the quarter, which marked the first time the iPhone passed 22M domestically, was particularly impressive because the promotional season wasn’t as aggressive as in the past and upgrade rates were slightly lower on the year. 
    • Despite reports of Q1 production cuts, the iPhone X outsold the 8 and 8 Plus by a 2:1 margin in Q4. 
    • Refurbished iPhones: Apple could drive sales for its older iPhone models with refurbished iPhone 7 and 7 Plus models available through the official store for $499 (32GB model) to $679 (256GB model). 
    • India import tax raised again: Apple’s attempt to gain more than 3% of the Indian market hits another hurdle as the import tax increases from 15% to 20%. 
    • The rate was hiked five percentage points to 15% in December. 
    • The iPhone SE is the only model assembled locally and exempt from the import tax. But Reuters sources said Apple assembler Wistron plans a new iPhone 6s plant in the country.  
    • Previously: Apple admits to government questioning; new iPhone coming to India? (Jan. 31)

  • SGEN

    Wainwright bullish on Seattle Genetics on tucatinib prospects, sees 34% upside

    • Uber-bull H.C. Wainwright likes Seattle Genetics' (SGEN +8.7%) $614M takeout of Cascadian Therapeutics (BUY/$75). Analyst Andrew Fein says investors may not fully appreciate the value of Cascadian's lead drug tucatinib, a tyrosine kinase inhibitor that sidesteps unwanted side effects like diarrhea and liver toxicity, due to its enhanced selectivity for the growth factor receptor HER2. It acts without significantly inhibiting the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) which causes the unwanted toxicity.
    • Fein points out that tucatinib has a more favorable safety profile than Puma Biotechnology's (PBYI -1.5%) NERLYNX (neratinib) and Novartis' (NVS +0.5%) TYKERB (lapatinib) which bodes well for grabbing a healthy portion of the HER2+ breast cancer market.
    • Needham's Chad Messer is also on board (BUY/$72) citing SGEN's continued diversification from just antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs), although he adds that a key value drive is the anticipated FDA approval of Adcetris (brentuximab vedotin) for first-line Hodgkin lymphoma (action date: May 1).
    • Source: Bloomberg

  • AFMD

    Updated data on Affimed's AFM13 shows 89% response rate in HL patients; shares up 28%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Affimed N.V. (AFMD +28.3%) is up on a 7x surge in volume on the heels of its announcement of updated data from two clinical trials evaluating lead candidate AFM13 in lymphoma patients.
    • Interim results from a Phase 1b study assessing the combination of AFM13 and Merck's (MRK +0.9%) KEYTRUDA (pembrolizumab) in Hodgkin lymphoma (HL) showed an 89% overall response rate (ORR) (n=8/9), including four complete metabolic responses. The other patient had stable disease, implying a disease control rate (DCR) of 100%. The historical ORR for KEYTRUDA alone in HL is 58 - 63%.
    • In a Phase 1b/2a study evaluating AFM13 as monotherapy in patients with CD30-positive cutaneous lymphoma, the ORR was 66% (n=2/3) with one patient showing stable disease, implying a DCR of 100% as well.
    • AFM13 is a bispecific antibody that binds to a protein expressed in a range of T-cell and B-cell lymphomas called CD30 and to a protein expressed on the immune system's natural killer cells called CD16A, both of which play key roles in the activation of the immune system to detect and kill cancer cells.
    • Previously: Affimed's lead candidate shows treatment benefit in early-stage study; investors unimpressed, shares down 27% (Dec. 11, 2017)

    Microsoft Q3 guidance beats revenue estimates

    • Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) provides Q3 revenue guidance on its earnings call.
    • Revenue, about $25.25B to $25.95B (consensus: $25.53B); Productivity and Business Processes, $8.6B to $8.8B; Intelligent Cloud, $7.55B to $7.75B; More Personal Computing, $9.1B to $9.4B. 
    • The company expects the effective tax rate for H2 to be 14% to 18% with a slightly below 21% effective tax rate for FY19. 
    • Microsoft sees FY18 operating margin slightly up on the year with roughly flat gross margin.   
    • Microsoft shares are down 0.3%.

  • AMD

    Argus upgrades AMD to 31% upside

    • Argus upgrades AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) from Hold to Buy with an $18 price target, a 31% upside on yesterday’s closing price.
    • Analyst Jim Kelleher says this week’s earnings report made it clear that AMD’s business model has a sustainable path towards profitability, top-line, and bottom-line growth. 
    • Kelleher notes that AMD continues to improve execution in high-cost and high-performance products, which positions AMD to take advantage of multiple categories experiencing global momentum. The categories include client and server computing, consumer gaming and electronics, graphics processing, cloud data center, AI, and blockchain. 
    • The analyst thinks AMD’s profit margins will eventually close the gap with stronger peers to become “industry competitive.” 
    • AMD shares are down 0.7%.    
    • Previously: AMD down despite Q4 beats, upside guidance (Jan. 30)

  • CNHI

    CNH CEO to mull spinoff options after credit rating raised

    • CNH Industrial (NYSE:CNHI) +4.7% premarket after CEO Richard Tobin discusses spinoff options, saying the farm equipment maker would work to strengthen its balance sheet this year before considering whether to separate its Iveco truck business from the more profitable tractor division.
    • CNH has been cutting debt, which boosted its credit rating to investment grade at two of the three major ratings agencies.
    • Moving firmly into the higher tier would give CNH “flexibility to consider a variety of different options for the assets portfolio, and what creates the most value,” Tobin tells Bloomberg. “You could spin out individual businesses with very efficient balance sheets.” but adds, “I am not saying we will do this.”
    • “At the end of the day, one doesn’t have to be a genius” to see that the agricultural equipment business would have higher multiples, and “if you want to get full value, you would delink" the two businesses, Tobin says.
